page.title: 16 TALKS WITH LOCAL PEOPLE
page.content: Rockhampton in 1985 had its bus service wihdrawn,so to take its place a mini-bus was sent every week on a certain day to take people to Bristol. This did not affect many people as they mostly had their own cars. It was found that most people in Rockhampton shopped for large items in Bristol and used the local shop for small items. If the people of Rockhampton wished to do sport and swim they could go to the Sports Centre in Thornbury where they could take part in squash,tennis, badminton,weight training,bowls, swimming,snooker or have a sauna. Cricket was played in Rockhampton on the Cricket Green. The people interviewed all worked locally,one was self-employed,one was a farrier,and one was a housewife. Each liked the area and found it clean and interesting.
